column2: Self-motivated and self-oriented. A preference for mapping out and following a personal path, with difficulties arising from external obstruction. Values independence and solitude. Enjoys the company of others, provided there is freedom for personal pursuits. A tendency toward egocentric and selfish behavior.

Identity and personal resources as the basis for all other success. A need for inner security before engaging with the world. Family roots and the home environment provide the foundations for self-discovery and self-knowledge that form the foundation for future success. A need to avoid becoming a stay-at-home.

Interactions with other people play a paramount role. Values both personal relationships and broader human interaction. A gift for mediation, possessing insight into the nuances of relationships. Self-discovery occurs primarily through relationships. A need to avoid being engulfed in stifling relationships.

Public life as the pinnacle. Personal satisfaction gained from worldly achievements, and self-knowledge learned through a position in the public arena. A need for a high public profile, met through both career and social status. A need to ensure achievements are not at the expense of loved ones.
